divs: Sighting DetailsWhile out getting my mail tonight I looked up to see some sort of object floating by overhead up in the sky. It is a very clear night with no clouds, little to no wind, and no moon. I thought it was a blimp or advertising balloon but then it started rotating on an axis and those things don't do that, nor did I see any navigation lights on this object. Plus its rate of movement was more on the order of a small plane or helicopter rather than blimp. The object was very dim in the sky but I could make out some sort of pattern of very dim lights or somesuch on its surface. I've seen advertising banners like this so I still think it might be that since the pattern on the object looked very much like what you would see on a Goodyear blimp (which I've seen numerous times at night), but the object was much longer, more like a towed banner. Time was 9:40PM, location Fair Oaks & Highway 101, direction the object was moving at a steady rate S-SE (the general direction of the wind), speed unknown but being so dim it left my visibility in about 1 minute when it moved near our complex's tennis court lights. Apparent size was about the width of 2 or 3 fingers overhead (unfortunately I didn't have the presence of mind to do this while viewing the object). Altitude unknown but not low. No noise.
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Sunnyvale
There were no other sightings in Sunnyvale on or around July 29th 2008
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: dim object with some sort of light pattern sighted moving overhead at night
